column2: Generate soundex code for a string which consist of occurances of a, e, i, o, u, y, h, w
column3: This test case takes an input, drops the occurances of a, e, i, o, u, y, h, w and replaces all consonents with numbers and returns soundex code as a output

column2: Generate soundex code for the string with letters having same number that are adjacent
column3: This test case takes an input and if two or more letters with the same number are adjacent, it only retain the first letter's soundex and returns soundex as a output

column2: Generate soundex code for the string with letters having same number are separated by 'h', 'w' or 'y'
column3: This test case takes an input and if two letters with the same number separated by 'h', 'w' or 'y', then it will be coded as a single number and returns soundex as a output

column2: Generate soundex code for the string with letters having same number are separated by vowel
column3: This test case takes an input and if two letters with the same number separated by vowel, then it will be coded twice and returns soundex as a output

column2: Generate soundex code for the string with first two letters having same number.
column3: This test case takes an input and verifies if first two letters have the same number then it will be  coded once as single letter and returns soundex as a output

column2: Generate soundex code for the string which has soundex code less than 4
column3: This test case takes an input, generates soundex and verifies the whether soundex length is four. if not, it appends remaining zeros and returns soundex with length four as a output

column2: Generate soundex for the empty string.
column3: This test case takes an input and verifies whether it is empty. If yes, then it returns empty string as output
